factText: Governor Larry Hogan Declares State of Emergency  Order Issued in Response to Heavy Rain, Extreme Flooding in Ellicott City and Areas Across Maryland  ANNAPOLIS, MD – Governor Larry Hogan today signed. (Kenneth K. Lam/The Baltimore Sun via AP)  CNN —  Maryland Gov. Larry Hogan declared a state of emergency Sunday in Howard County as a massive storm drenched the Baltimore region, triggering flash flo

(Kevin Rector, Baltimore Sun)  The deluge of rain that flooded Ellicott City on Sunday destroyed roads and prompted rescues and evacuations elsewhere across the region. Flooding prompts rescues, evacuations throughout Baltimore region. Residents in the cities of Ellicott and Baltimore scrambled for safety as heavy rainfall brought flash flooding to the area. Videos posted on social media sh..

Flooding submerged parts of Maryland Sunday, prompting water rescues and shutting down roads. And Main Street in Sykesville was closed due to flooding, with crews pumping out basements of businesses along the stretch, the Sykesville Fire Department wrote on Twitter. Roads closed, cars stranded, asphalt ruined.. #flooding #Birmingham #Harborne https://t.co/iUxXrQQiZm. 😥 Devastating flooding has once again hit Main Street in Old Ellicott City 😥 #ecstrong

factText: The executive order will allow the state to efficiently coordinate support and provide additional assistance to local jurisdictions experiencing flooding conditions. Authorizing the National Guard to respond to Ellicott City, Maryland tonight where flash floods have inundated the… https://t.co/jgSoylq6X9. Additionally, county, state and federal officials have partnered to address flooding.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-005_Flood_What is the government response to the flooding crisis?

factText: It took about three months for some of Main Street’s more than140 businesses to reopen after the flood.

RELATED: Flash Flood Warning Issued For Parts Of Maryland WJZ’s Kimberly Eiten said Main Street was a disaster zone by late Sunday night, with piles of debris strewn about the roadways. Under the glow of police lights, first responders walked through the wreckage that remained throughout Main Street on Sunday night. Main Street, also known as Frederick Road, was transformed into a waterway over the weekend, as brown water sluiced through town, destroying shops and upending cars.

GoFundMe pages have been set up in order to support many businesses affected by the flooding. To assist victims of the flooding, text “ECStrong” to 71777 or go to uwcm.org/ECStrong. I have directed Maryland Emergency Management Agency (MEMA) to assist in any capacity possible, and numerous other state agencies are providing support.

RELATED: How To Help With The Ellicott City Flooding  For those impacted by yesterday’s flood in Ellicott City, the county has opened a hotline to provide information and assistance at 410-313-2900. For those impacted by yesterday's flood in Ellicott City, we have opened a hotline to provide information and assistance at 410-313-2900. Those affected by the storm who are in need of non-emergency assistance can call Howard County Police Department at 410-313-2200.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-005_general_What emergency numbers should people call for help during {event}?

factText: Some people who live in the area told The Baltimore Sun the flooding seemed worse than what they saw two years ago, when a storm killed two people and destroyed some local businesses.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-005_general_How are businesses and local economies affected by {event}?

factText: The provider predicted extended outages of gas and electric service in areas of heavy flooding until equipment could be examined and possibly rebuilt. Extended outages are possible where buildings and infrastructure sustained heavy damage. Over 1,100 without power in Cave Spring likely from #flooding. #rke #vawx https://t.co/QKRTUjQ4OU. Hundreds more had been without power Sunday night.
About 3 to 5 inches of rain had fallen, the National Weather Service reported after 5 p.m., with additional rain anticipated.
Two people died in floodwaters and 150 people were rescued downtown, including 80 from vehicles and 40-plus from Phoenix Emporium, officials said.
FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY once again in Ellicott City, MD.

Video of flooding in downtown Ellicott City. U15 and Boat 15 are assisting on this situation with 4 volunteers. The United Way of Central Maryland said Monday that it has re-established the ECStrong Fund it launched in 2016 to provide humanitarian relief to those affected by the flooding.

factText: one person missing -- a man born in 1978#gmm2 — Christian Schaffer (@schafferwmar) May 28, 2018  Original story: Heavy rains soaking much of Maryland have led to flash flooding in parts of the state. No one was killed in this weekend's flooding, but officials reported 30 rescues in Ellicott City and one person is listed as missing, WMAR reported.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-005_general_Are there any missing persons reports related to {event}?

factText: Maryland Gov. Larry Hogan has already declared a state of emergency for the area. FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY remains in effect for Ellicott City, MD in Howard County. Fire officials are telling residents to stay inside and not to call 911 if they are in a safe place. People are urged to avoid downtown, which the county executive and governor have declared in a state of emergency. Relief efforts are underway for businesses and residents.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-005_general_Are evacuation orders still in place or have they been lifted?
